intro: Thyrsacanthus calycotrichus, commonly known as the woolly burr, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its unique, spiny, woolly fruits that form in clusters, which help in seed dispersal by attaching to animal fur. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
